script.message: Hi!
It is known that Lobula Plate Tangential Cells are an essential component of optomotor responses.
Let's try and find some  LPTCs from the FlyCircuit data:

script.query: show neurons connecting the left lop to the left cvlp

script.message: Now let's add neurons from the other side of the brain.

script.query: add neurons connecting the right lop to the right cvlp

script.message: Now let's select from the workspace some tangential cells and pin them.
Let's remove the unpinned neurons.
And unpin all the pinned neurons.
Now let's hide the neurons one by one
Let's bring back one of the neurons!
Done
Try exploring detailed information from the Info Panel!

lptc.description: Query for Lobula Plate Tangential Cells.

script.message: In NeuroNLP, neurons of existing cell types can be directly queried by their name

script.query: add Mi1 neuron in the home column in medulla
color Mi1 neuron in the home column orange
add Mi4 neuron in column A in medulla
color Mi4 neuron in column A f000f6
add Mi9 neuron in column B in medulla
color Mi9 neuron in column B white
add Dm8 neuron in column C in medulla
color Dm8 neuron in column C yellow
add Dm2 neuron in column E in medulla
color Dm2 neuron in column E cyan

script.message: Done! Explore it yourself!

fig2a.keyword: Fig 2a. Selected neuron types in the Medulla
fig2a.description: Neurons of existing cell types can be directly queried by their name.

script.message: In this demo, we use connectome data to construct the neural circuit in the ON motion Pathway in the Medulla. We start from the L1 neuron.

script.query: show L1 neuron in the home cartridge in the lamina
add postsynaptic neurons with at least 20 synapses in the home column
add postsynaptic neurons with at least 10 synapses in the home column
color neurons in the home column white
add L1 neuron in cartridge A in the lamina
add postsynaptic neurons with at least 20 synapses in column A
add postsynaptic neurons with at least 10 synapses in column A
color neurons in column A green
add L1 neuron in cartridge B in the lamina
add postsynaptic neurons with at least 20 synapses in column B
add postsynaptic neurons with at least 10 synapses in column B
color neurons in column B cyan
add L1 neuron in cartridge C in the lamina
add postsynaptic neurons with at least 20 synapses in column C
add postsynaptic neurons with at least 10 synapses in column C
color neurons in column C yellow
add L1 neuron in cartridge D in the lamina
add postsynaptic neurons with at least 20 synapses in column D
add postsynaptic neurons with at least 10 synapses in column D
color neurons in column D blue
add L1 neuron in cartridge E in the lamina
add postsynaptic neurons with at least 20 synapses in column E
add postsynaptic neurons with at least 10 synapses in column E
color neurons in column E magenta
add L1 neuron in cartridge F in the lamina
add postsynaptic neurons with at least 20 synapses in column F
add postsynaptic neurons with at least 10 synapses in column F
color neurons in column F green

fig2a2.keyword: Fig 2a (2). Columnar neurons from 7 columns of Medulla.

script.message: The Lobula Plate Tangential Cells (LPTCs) are essential elements in the fly optomotor pathway. Two types of LPTCs have been the subject of intensive investigation. However, more than 20 anatomical classes of LPTCs are known in the blowfly (Hausen, 1984, Fig. 3). Little is known about the existence and if exist, the function the their homologies in the fruit fly visual system. Here we use NeuroNLP to identify LPTCs that may exist in the FlyCircuit data, and their anatomical classes.

Most of the literature shows that LPTCs have extensive dendritic arborizations in the lobula plate (LOP) and can terminate either in the contralateral LOP, or in the ipsilateral and/or contralateral caudal ventrolateral protocerebrum (CVLP)
We first search for the former.

script.query: show neurons connecting left lop to right lop
add neurons connecting right lop to left lop

script.message: We found two types of neurons based on their morphology
The first type resembles the H1 neurons
The other two neurons are possibly of an unknown type or V3.
We now search for LPTCs that connect to ipsilateral CVLP.

script.query: show neurons connecting left lop to left cvlp
add neurons connecting right lop to right cvlp

script.message: Let's remove the unpinned neurons.
And unpin all the pinned neurons.
Among these we have CH cells, whose cell bodies are characteristically located around the oesophagus.
Next we highlight a VS cell.
Then we have an unknown type but its arborization in Lobula plate resembles V1 cells.
and a type of LPTC that has vertical arborization pattern.
Next, we search for LPTCs that sends to the contralateral CVLP.

script.query: show neurons connecting left lop to right cvlp
add neurons connecting right lop to left cvlp

script.message: We found one neuron resembling H2 neuron.
and some resembling H3 neuron.
and some resembling H4 neuron.
Done! Explore it yourself!

fig2b.description: Defining subclasses of the Lobula Plate Tangential Cells.

script.message: In Fischbach and Dittrich (1989), only one type of Lobula Plate (LOP) local neuron was observed. Mauss et al. (2015) identified two types of glutamatergic inhibitory local neurons that bi-stratify in layers 3/4 of Lobula Plate (LPi neurons), including the one mentioned in Fischbach and Dittrich (1989). With NeuroNLP, we ask if we can further expand the local neuron cell types in the LOP.
We first query glutamatergic neurons in the LOP and select neurons that resemble the tiling pattern of LPi 3-4 neurons.

script.query: show glutamatergic local neurons in lop

script.message: Here, we observe that there are some neurons that have smaller arborization fields that matches the description of LPi 3-4 in Mauss et al. (2015). We pick out these neurons in the left LOP and look at their tiling pattern.

We also observe that there are neurons that have elongated arborization field that stretch through the lobula plate in dorsal-ventral axis. We pin a few of them in the right LOP so that they tile the LOP.
Are there any other local neurons in the LOP?

script.query: show GABAergic local neurons in lop

script.message: It looks like there are a few GABAergic local neurons, with similar shapes as glutamatergic local neurons.

script.query: show cholinergic local neurons in lop

script.message: There are also more cholinergic local neurons of similar shapes as glutamatergic local neurons. However, from the sample of neurons in the database, glutamatergic neurons are majority of local neurons in the LOP.
Done! Explore it yourself!

fig2c.description: Discovering a new type of LPi local neuron in the Lobula Plate.

script.message: In this demo, we use connectome data to construct the neural circuit in the ON motion Pathway in the Medulla. We start from a T4a neuron that is known to be directionally selective to front-to-back motion and trace back a neural circuit that provide direct and indirect inputs to this neuron.

script.query: add presynaptic neurons with at least 3 synapses
add presynaptic neurons with at least 5 synapses

script.message: We first make all neurons to white and start to color each column

script.query: color neurons in medulla and lamina white
color neurons in column home red
color neurons in column A green
color neurons in column B yellow
color neurons in column C blue
color neurons in column D magenta
color neurons in column E cyan
color neurons in column F brown
color T4 neuron in the home column pink

script.message: We notice that there are still a lot of neurons left in white, suggesting a large number of non-columnar neurons take part in processing visual signal in motion detection circuit.
We remove columnar neurons to show the non-columnar neurons.

script.query: remove columnar neurons

script.message: Done! Explore it yourself!

fig3a.description: Constructing ON Motion Pathway in the Medulla (Please use Firefox to run this demo, Chrome/Safari limits the amount of memory one browser tab can use).

script.message: In Sun et al. (2017), a two-stage visual pathway  between the medulla and the bulb (BU, or lateral triangle) was uncovered. This identifies potential sources of visual input to ring neurons that links BU and EB, a neuropil that is believed to maintain an internal compass of the fly. We can inspect this pathway by a few queries and GUI operations

script.query: show neurons that connect right OPTU to right LAT

script.message: This query results in 1 neuron referred to as TB neuron in Sun et al. (2017)

script.query: add neurons that connect left optu and left lat

script.message: We found 4 GABAergic TB neurons
and 1 cholinergic TB neuron

Note that previous experiments have only shown that TB neurons are excitatory, as ex vivo optogenetic activation of a TB neuron led to increased calcium activity in ring neurons (Sun et al., 2017). The results of these two queries suggest that additional experiments are necessary to dissect the input signals to ring neurons.
Now  we  can  inspect  the  inferred  postsynaptic neurons of these TB neuron.
We add one neuron that resemble the Ring neuron
We add two more Ring neurons
This suggests that indeed the TB neuron putatively provide inputs to ring neurons.
We now inspect the TB neuronâ€™s inferred presynaptic partners.
We add one neuron that projects from Medulla
We add another neuron that projects from Medulla

script.query: add neurons that connect left medulla to left optu
add neurons that connect right MED to right OPTU

script.message: We found two distinct populations of neurons projecting from Medulla to OPTU. The first population project to the ventral proximal parts of the OPTU, overlapping with the area where TB neurons extend their dendrites. These neurons seem to match the description of the MT neurons (Sun et al, 2017). They have large dendritic arborization in the middle layers of medulla - potentially in layer 6 where they receive color visual information. A majority of them are cholinergic, but a few others are GABAergic.

A second population project their axons to more dorsal part of the OPTU. Their dendrite innervate only the proximal medulla and are restricted in the parts of medulla that receive visual infornation from the lower back sides of the eyes.
We remove the second population of neurons that innervate the upper part of OPTU. Many of them are fru expressing neurons.

script.query: remove fru expressing neurons

script.message: We add a few putative presynaptic neurons that receive contralateral inputs.
For another neuron.
And yet another.
Done! Explore it yourself!

fig3b.keyword: Fig 3b. A Visual Pathway to EB
fig3b.description: Constructing a visual pathway to EB from connectome data based on Sun et al. (2017).

script.query: show L1 neuron in the home cartridge in the lamina

script.message: Done! Explore it yourself!

fig4a.description: Synaptic Sites of a T4a Neurons.
